intro: Boehmeria platyphylla var. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited nettle, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging nettle species. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a serrated margin. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in spikes and are typically wind-pollinated. This variant is distinguished by its smaller fruits compared to other varieties within the species.
